text: <@U03JDEHCX17> how did you get an app installed if you don't have oAuth setup? The redirect URL has a `code` value in the URL. I put junk into the redirectURL, but the app I have created is not completing install. I have a workflow action i developed and just want to test it in a portal. cc <@U01QVR44MEY>
It works fine to do it like that
Just make sure you set published true in the workflow action creation
yeah i have that.
we are getting oAuth setup, but it's not ready yet, so trying to work on this in the meantime.
Using a bogus redirect url will still install the action on the HubSpot account
e.g. if I put in <http://google.com|google.com> as my redirect, I'll go through the install process and end up at `<https://www.google.com/?code=><some guid>`
the app is not installed into the portal
not listed
It's not install under the connect apps section?
Also what type of portal is this?
correct
its a test portal from my developer account
Do you possibly have a real portal? or just access to a real portal?
yes. just tested it. same thing
you sure I don't have to do something with the code that is returned in the redirect URL? Are there scopes that i shouldn't have?
Nope I do it all the time without setting up oauth

Does anyone have problems with using hs commands in the command line. My says zsh: command not found: hs. Nothing works to get the hs command line to work for me. I have it globally and locally installed.

my CLI was fine and then all of a sudden none of the commands worked the last two times I tried. I thought it was something with my mac, but haven't had a chance to figure out what's wrong. Same exact error/situation.
I am also on a mac! I cannot get it to work and any fixes do not fix it! I am glad it’s not just me
I had to follow these steps, and it worked the first time, but it doesn't let me back in now <https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally>

for future reference: me and Scott solved this over dms and then a call. basically for the app to install fully you need to at least request an access token once. this wan't how it used to work, I don't know when this changed but I wish it wasn't like this.
thanks so much for your help <@U01QVR44MEY>
No, it didn’t work :disappointed:
maybe it's a broader issue :dotted_line_face:
Hi folks! Could you try prefixing your `hs` commands with `npx` ? So for example, `hs auth` would become `npx hs auth` , `hs upload` would be `npx hs upload`, etc.
That works! Thank you Allison!
Any insights why this happens to us and not others, and what the npx does/means?
